snippet: Diagnoses have soared as makers of the drugs used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder have found success with a two-decade marketing campaign.
abstract: Diagnoses of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder have soared as makers of drugs used to treat ADHD have found success with a two-decade marketing campaign; federal data shows that diagnosis has been made in 15 percent of high school-age children, and number of children on medication for ADHD has soared to 3.5 million from 600,000 in 1990.
lead_paragraph: Diagnoses have soared as makers of the drugs used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder have found success with a two-decade marketing campaign.

headline.main: The Selling of Attention Deficit Disorder
headline.print_headline: The Selling of Attention Deficit Disorder
